articles.title: New Zika virus lineages show increased fitness - News-Medical.Net
articles.description: The current study, published in the journal PLOS Neglected Tropical Diseases, aimed to explore the possible phenotypic adaptation of the Zika virus to increase its transmissibility and virulence in the Americas.
articles.content: Zika virus infections have become a local epidemic in the Americas at various time points in the recent past. A recent study attempted to explore whether this was due to increased transmissibility ch… [+7246 chars]

articles.author: Hannah Sparks
articles.title: Stomach flu symptoms to watch for as outbreak spreads across US: CDC - New York Post
articles.description: Stomach “bugs” are in bloom as the US Centers for Disease Control warns Americans about widespread outbreaks across the country.
articles.content:
This is retched news.
Stomach bugs are in bloom in the US. Also known as the stomach flu (though unrelated to influenza), the highly contagious gastrointestinal illness is typically caused by norovi… [+4990 chars]

articles.author: life
articles.title: Legendary songwriter Burt Bacharach dead at 94 - News24
articles.description: Legendary American pop composer Burt Bacharach, whose prolific output provided a chart-topping playlist for the 1960s and 70s with hits like "I Say a Little Prayer," has died in Los Angeles aged 94, US media said Thursday.
articles.content:
• Composer Burt Bacharach has died at the age of 94.
  • Bacharach worked with stars such as Dionne Warwick, Aretha Franklin, Dusty Springfield and Tom Jones.
